clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Interscalene Block on Heart Rate Variability (HRV)
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Interscalene Block on Heart's Autonomic Nervous System With Heart Rate Variability Measurement

brief_summary.textblock: The Left interscalene block has a different effect on heart's autonomic nervous system, as measured with Heart Rate Variability, compared to Right interscalene block

primary_outcome.measure: Effect of interscalene block on Heart Rate Variability (HRV)
primary_outcome.description: The Left interscalene block has different effect on heart's autonomic nervous system, as measured with HRV, than the Right.

secondary_outcome.measure: Interscalene block and beach chair positioning
secondary_outcome.description: Effect of interscalene block on hypotension during beach chair positioning

secondary_outcome.measure: Interscalene block and beach chair positioning
secondary_outcome.description: Effect of interscalene block on bradycardia during beach chair positioning

arm_group.description: Left shoulder surgery under left interscalene block and HRV
Right shoulder surgery under right interscalene block and HRV

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- elective shoulder surgery
- Age 20- 45 years old
- ASA I - II
Exclusion Criteria:
- Coagulopathy disorders
- Infection at the puncture site for the interscalene block
- Neurologic deficit in the arm that is going to be operated
- Allergy to local anesthetics
- BMI > 35
- Psychiatric disorders
- Patient's refusal
- Problems with patient communication
- Arrythmia
- Ischaemic heart disease
- Diabetes mellitus
- Thyroid function disorders
- Patients with conduction disorders on the ECG
- Electrolyte disorders (K+, Na+, Ca++)
- Patients on medication that affect the ECG
